channel.title: Ramah: Good News Feed
channel.description: Positive news stories from around the world, filtered by sentiment analysis

item.title: 'It is lovely to talk about St Brigid in a school named after her'
item.description: For more than 20 years Carmel Hayes has been visiting St Brigid's Primary School in Drumilly, south Armagh to teach children how to make St Brigid's crosses.

item.title: Wil Anderson: ‘I honestly believe being mistaken for Adam Hills is one of the great gifts of my life’
item.description: I know Adam Hills did one of these and he chose me as his nemesis because we often get confused.

item.title: Ekitiké and Wirtz sink Newcastle before Konaté seals welcome Liverpool win
item.description: You could say Hugo Ekitiké was the one who got away from Newcastle last summer, except there were so many.

item.title: Quick hits: Epic final takes stars into uncharted territory as Nadal picks a winner
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka doesn't "want to think about tennis" after another brutal loss in the women's final and Rafael Nadal picks his men's champion.

item.title: ‘The best movement is the next movement’: how to really look after your lower back
item.description: Getting out of bed.

item.title: NSW Greens to move bill to let councils better regulate berry industry as it continues rapid expansion
item.description: Cate Faehrmann, a Greens member of the New South Wales legislative council, will move a private member’s bill next week to give councils more power to regulate blueberry and other berry farms which are expanding throughout the mid-north coast, leading to serious frictions with other landholders.

item.title: Dog Park review – this charming comedy lures you in with dogs – but you’ll stay for the humans
item.description: How do you create interesting drama themed around a dog park? If you’ve been to one before, it doesn’t exactly scream “riveting”.

item.description: In 2015, I moved to Sydney from north Wales in the UK.

item.title: ‘People were starving for it’: Mem Fox on the incredible, surprising success of Possum Magic
item.description: Much like Hush, the picture book’s marsupial protagonist, Fox took the long way round.

item.title: The ‘pleasant fiction’ of a rules-based order has been blown apart. It’s time for Australia to codify a bill of rights | Julianne Schultz
item.description: For decades, Labor governments have been waiting for a “catalysing political trigger” to convince the opposition that there was a real and urgent need for a comprehensive, codified Australian charter of rights as exists in all other comparable nations.

item.title: Australia’s best photos of the month – January 2026
item.description: Bushfires, marches and a summer of sport – Guardian Australia’s best photos from around the countryPrayers, vigils and mitzvahs on the national day of mourning for Bondi beach terror attack victims – in picturesDrag racing at Sydney’s weekly street meet offers a change of pace for all walks of life Continue reading.

item.description: LONDON (AP) — Britain’s royal family is facing a fresh round of embarrassment after the latest release of documents from the U.S.

item.title: Championship roundup: QPR comeback stuns Coventry as Boro move level with win
item.description: Stuttering Coventry’s grip at the top of the Championship loosened further as QPR came from behind to beat them 2-1 at Loftus Road.

item.title: Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina defeats No. 1 Aryana Sabalenka to win Australian Open
item.description: MELBOURNE, Australia — Elena Rybakina finally won her second Grand Slam title with a victory over top-ranked Aryna Sabalenka at the Australian Open on Saturday, and it was something of a testament to quiet achievers.

item.title: Arsenal stroll back to winning ways against outclassed Leeds and go seven points clear
item.description: It would be a touch too hyperbolic to suggest this was a season-defining afternoon for Arsenal’s title ambitions, but given the opposition and the pre-match drama surrounding this game, there was no doubting that come full time this was a significant one in the Premier League title picture.

item.title: ‘I always believed’: Elena Rybakina relishes return to top table after Melbourne glory
item.description: Elena Rybakina never stopped believing she would collect a second grand slam title after holding her nerve to defeat Aryna Sabalenka, the world No 1 and two-time champion, 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 and win the Australian Open.

item.title: Pet sounds: Why some dog owners share music with their 4-legged friends
item.description: People use music to set moods, create a desired atmosphere and evoke memories of family and friends.

item.title: ‘It’s astonishing how well it has lasted’: Anglesey marks 200th anniversary of beloved bridge
item.description: When Ian Evans’s grandfather opened a hardware shop on Anglesey in the 1930s, the Menai Bridge was instrumental in ensuring its success.

item.title: A wing and a prayer: Rybakina’s quiet resolve wrests glory from Sabalenka | Jack Snape
item.description: The sprinkling rain at Melbourne Park meant the roof stayed closed on centre court for the Australian Open women’s final, turning Rod Laver Arena into a concert hall charged with the music of tennis.

item.description: Germans love their potatoes.

item.title: Women’s Champions Cup final: Arsenal chase more glory against ‘intense’ Corinthians

item.description: So how will Rybakina handle her nerves here? She hasn’t been in this position, serving for a grand slam title, since the Wimbledon final in 2022, when she won her first and only major.

item.title: Student loan system 'fair and reasonable', says Reeves
item.description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves has described the student loans system as "fair and reasonable" after criticism over the decision to freeze the repayment threshold for some borrowers.

item.title: Catherine O’Hara, Emmy-winning comedian of ‘Schitt’s Creek’ and ‘SCTV’ fame, dies at 71
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Catherine O’Hara, a gifted Canadian comic actor and “SCTV” alum who starred as Macaulay Culkin’s harried mother in two “Home Alone” movies and created the dramatically ditzy character of Moira Rose in the Emmy-winning comedy “Schitt’s Creek,” died Friday.

item.title: Novak Djokovic thanks doubters for giving him strength after Sinner success
item.description: Novak Djokovic thanked his doubters for helping to give him strength after he produced an incredible performance to defeat Jannik Sinner, the No 2 and two-time defending champion, 3-6, 6-3, 4-6, 6-4, 6-4 to reach the Australian Open final.

item.title: 10 of the greatest songs by Sly Dunbar – from reggae classics to Grace Jones and Bob Dylan
item.description: It isn’t Sly Dunbar’s most spectacular performance as a drummer – although his playing is right in the pocket: listen to the lightness of his touch on the cymbals and the tightness of his occasional fills – but as recording debuts go, appearing on an early 70s reggae classic in your teens, a single that furthermore went to No 1 in the UK and sold 300,000 copies despite British radio’s disinclination to play it, is quite the impressive way to open your account.
